props.code:
PROJECTM_PLAYLIST_EXPORT char ** projectm_playlist_items(
    projectm_playlist_handle instance,
    uint32_t start,
    uint32_t count
)

children.value: Returns a list of preset files inside the given range of the current playlist, in order.
The zero-based starting index of the range to return.
The maximum number if items to return.
: A pointer to a list of char pointers, each containing a single preset. The last entry is denoted by a null pointer.
when you're done using the list.
Ideally, don't rely on the value provided as count to iterate over the filenames. Instead, look for the terminating null pointer to abort the loop.
This function can be used to return the whole playlist to save it to a file, or just a part of it for use in virtual lists. If less elements than given in
are available, only the remainder of items after the starting index are returned. If the starting index equals or exceeds the playlist size, an empty list is returned.

The index to retrieve the filename for.

when you're done using the return value.
If you need to retrieve a major part of playlist filenames, use
Appends presets from the given path to the end of the current playlist.
A local filesystem path to scan for presets.
If true, subdirectories of the given path will also be scanned. If false, only the exact path given is searched for presets.
If true, files found will always be added. If false, only files are added that do not already exist in the current playlist.
: The number of files added. 0 may indicate issues scanning the path.
This method will scan the given path for files with a ".milk" extension and add these to the playlist.

)

children.value: Inserts presets from the given path to the end of the current playlist.
A local filesystem path to scan for presets.
The index to insert the presets at. If it exceeds the playlist size, the presets are added at the end of the playlist.
If true, subdirectories of the given path will also be scanned. If false, only the exact path given is searched for presets.
If true, files found will always be added. If false, only files are added that do not already exist in the current playlist.
: The number of files added. 0 may indicate issues scanning the path.
This method will scan the given path for files with a ".milk" extension and add these to the playlist.
Adds a single preset to the end of the playlist.
If true, the preset filename will always be added. If false, the preset is only added to the playlist if the exact filename doesn't exist in the current playlist.
: True if the file was added to the playlist, false if the file was a duplicate and allow_duplicates was set to false.
: The file is not checked for existence or for being readable.
Adds a single preset to the playlist at the specified position.
The index to insert the preset at. If it exceeds the playlist size, the preset is added at the end of the playlist.
If true, the preset filename will always be added. If false, the preset is only added to the playlist if the exact filename doesn't exist in the current playlist.
: True if the file was added to the playlist, false if the file was a duplicate and allow_duplicates was set to false.
: The file is not checked for existence or for being readable.
To always add a file at the end of the playlist, use
Adds a list of presets to the end of the playlist.
A list of local preset filenames.
The number of files in the list.
If true, the preset filenames will always be added. If false, a preset is only added to the playlist if the exact filename doesn't exist in the current playlist.
: The number of files added to the playlist. Ranges between 0 and count.
: The files are not checked for existence or for being readable.

props.code:
PROJECTM_PLAYLIST_EXPORT void projectm_playlist_sort(
    projectm_playlist_handle instance,
    uint32_t start_index,
    uint32_t count,
    projectm_playlist_sort_predicate predicate,
    projectm_playlist_sort_order order
)

children.value: Sorts part or the whole playlist according to the given predicate and order.
The starting index to begin sorting at.
The number of items, beginning at start_index, to sort.
The predicate to use for sorting. Default is SORT_PREDICATE_FULL_PATH.
The sort order. Default is SORT_ORDER_ASCENDING.

It is safe to provide values in start_index and count that will exceed the number of items in the playlist. Only items that fall into an existing index range are sorted. If start_index is equal to or larger than the playlist size, no items are sorted. If start_index is inside the playlist, but adding count results in an index outside the playlist, items until the end are sorted.
Sort order is lexicographical for both predicates and case-sensitive.
If invalid values are provides as predicate or order, the defaults as mentioned in the parameter description are used.
